definition: lit. house made of gold/fig. luxurious residence
surname Huang or Hwang
yellow/pornographic/to fall through
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1],個|个[ge4]
lit. in books are sumptuous houses and graceful ladies (proverb)/fig. be diligent in your studies, success and glory will follow
pinyin: shu1 zhong1 zi4 you3 huang2 jin1 wu1 , shu1 zhong1 zi4 you3 yan2 ru2 yu4
containing_words.word: 書中自有黃金屋，書中自有顏如玉

sentences.english: A book holds a house of gold.
sentences.chinese: 書中自有黃金屋可以翻成。

sentences.english: Don't need to build high towers for cozy living; There are houses of gold in books.
sentences.chinese: 安居不用架高樓，書中自有黃金屋。
